text: Hasret Kayikçi (born 6 November 1991) is a German football player of Turkish origin. She plays as a striker for SC Freiburg and the German national team. ==Career== ===Club=== Kayikçi grew up in Heidelberg-Rohrbach and started her career at TSG Rohrbach. After a year in the federation league team (with 30 goals), she joined as a 16-year-old in the summer of 2008 to Bundesliga team FCR 2001 Duisburg and she debuted on 7 September 2008 against Herforder SV. A week later they scored a 4: 3 away win against Hamburger SV; her first Bundesliga goal. In May 2011, she moved to SC Freiburg.SC Freiburg brings Hasret Kayikci In April 2012, she experienced severe assault of a new cruciate ligament injury, which initially remained undetected.Second cruciate ligament in Kayikci After a long break, she participated in their first Bundesliga game in the season 2012/2013 and scored a goal. After three games, Kayikçi fell again due to a knee injury. She could attend a game in the 2013/2014 season. After a long pause and rehab, she celebrated her comeback in the Bundesliga at start of season 2014/15 on 30 August 2014.The battle for the championship trophy begins ===National team=== Kayikçi adopted German citizenship and was part of the squad of the U-17 national team for the World Cup in New Zealand.Hasret Kayikci to World Cup squad She also belonged to the squad of the U-19 national team for the European Championship in Macedonia. She suffered a cruciate ligament injury in the final group game. ==International goal== Scores and results list Germany's goal tally first: {| class="wikitable" |- !colspan="7"|Kayikçi – goals for Germany |- ! # !!
